meanings.sent1: The students serry around the teacher during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The fans serryed together to get a better view of the concert.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to serry up and form a line to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds serryed together, blocking out the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fish serryed in the coral reef, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To press closely together in a mass
meanings.sent1: The books serryed on the shelf, making it hard to find the one I needed.
meanings.sent2: The cars serryed on the highway during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The cookies serryed together on the plate, tempting me to take one.
meanings.sent4: The sheep serryed in the pen, waiting to be sheared.
meanings.sent5: The leaves serryed on the ground, creating a colorful carpet in the park.
